My husband worked in the restaurant business for many years, so he understands the expectations of management and how to provide good service. So, when we go out to eat, initial acknowledgement by a server is pretty much on a timer with him. When we are going to spend money someplace decent service is huge and this place lost.
The best wings I've ever tasted. I didn't think I liked wings much, but I tasted these and highly recommend them.
Decided to have a family night out.  We really enjoyed the high tables.  The food was great, loved the fried pickles and pretzel buns.  They even had a free little holiday treat for the kids.

Drove by dozens of times and finally stopped in.  Walked in the front door and first impression was "Oh Ya" nothing fancy, light woods and inviting.  Sat outside in the patio next to the fountain. the patio, on the east side of the building so the sun was not ontop of us, lots of trees and plants, soothing confortable place and we can smoke.  We had the meat and cheese board, very good.  Large selection of beer and also a orange blood margarita, very good.  We will for sure be going back.  Would like to try the burgers.
Gorgeous outdoor patio and the inside is very authentic and cozy. Service is great and the chicken pot pie is amazing!

My friends and i stopped in to have some
lunch and we were quite impressed!  From the service to the amazing food! Best nachos I've ever had (they use nacho cheese, not shredded cheese). My French dip was tasty, and the portions are huge!! Prices are fair. Wish they had one of these in Vegas! I'm still craving those nachos and I want to go back!!
Tried the fried egg burger. Delicious!  My wife and I are really starting to like this place. I would recommend giving it a shot!

"Meh" is about right...

I really wanted to like this place.... When we walked in there was sign that said "please seat your self", so we bellied up to the bar. We sat there for just few mins waiting for the bartender to come out of the kitchen.... Whatever. It wasn't busy by any means. I do like the beers on tab, however a little out of season for most of them. I can't drink heavy beer during the summer. The menu was small and not really what I was expecting. I ordered the Cajun burger... "Meh" is a good word this too. It came with the 2 tinniest onion rings I have seen, and they immediately fell off. The flavor was kinda strange... not gonna lie. I was starving and I couldn't even finish it, because the flavor was so unappetizing! The french fires I ordered on the side were cold and had way too much seasoning. My boyfriend had the roast beef sandwich. It was better then mine, but that ain't saying much. I think my real annoyance comes from the fact that the bartender offered us things like onion rings and additional cheese with out mentioning that they were an extra charge. I knew they were extra, but I don't like it when my "server" tries to jack-up my tab. 

They have live music... which I don't think I would have enjoyed... From the posters, the musicians all looked kind of aggressive and loud... Not typical dining music. They also have "Carver Jones" playing there... He plays everywhere in Chandler. He's also kind of douchey. 

All-in-all, I really cant see my self returning... Their are several other places with more menu options.

PASS....

Went to Harvey's when it first opened, and you could tell they had some work to do to iron out the kinks of a new restaurant.  Wasn't initially impressed, except that the team was friendly and open to feedback.  

Just left there tonight, and man is that the place to be in the San Tan area.  The open air bar area was packed with people and the drinks were flowing.  The team was on their A game with refills of drinks before you could ask.  I think they added a few TVs as you could watch the Cardinals game all over the place.

Wife and I ordered the Strawberry Salad, and it's often hard to find a place that uses dark greens as generous as Harvey's does.  No wilted greens here, it was if they had picked it fresh out of the garden out back. Fresh bleu cheese and candied walnuts with other dried fruits all added to the richness of the salad.  

I gotta say tonight's experience has me looking at the calendar slotting the next visit.  Bravo team Harvey, bravo.

The restaurant looks great from the outside and has a good ambiance and this is all a cover up for bad food and bad service.
We sat at the bar and waited for a drink. The bartenders looked us straight in the eye and never acknowledged we were there. We had to ask for a drink.  That was a long agonizing process.
We told the hostess we would like a table. She said she would let us know when one came available. We waited and watched her seat others. She forgot.
Then when we finally got seated we waited again for almost 20 more minutes and once again we had to ask for a waitress to take out order.
Mind you..the waitresses walked past us at least a dozen times and didnt even acknowledge us. 
Then we ordered out food (two burgers)..that was another wait an we had to ask the waitress to check on our order. Food finally came and the burgers were similar to something I could have gotten at the Burger King drive thru! We asked for medium rare and we were presented with these well done hockey pucks! 
Really...nothing good to say about the experience.

Had the Cajun Burger with Garlic Fries. Just a note that the Burger was overcooked and dry as I ordered it Med/Well not well done but the small spread of Cajun dressing was flavorful and had a good kick to it. next time I will order a burger Medium. and the garlic fries just had some chopped garlic on them when I think they should have added some olive oil and parmesan-reggiano cheese on it.  Overall. I enjoyed the atmosphere and will be back.

Stopped in for some live music on Saturday, great crowd until the band started and 75% of the people left with in the first 3 songs.....and it was a mellow band!!!  Ordered my IPA and Jameson shot, and I know my whiskey, they had it watered down. DAMN IT!!!!  Bar staff was good, didn't try any food. Harvey's did nothing to excite me, doubt I'll be back.

My wife and I always drive by but never go in. Well, we changed that... We walked in and it was easy to find a seat as it wasn't busy yet. We were created properly and promptly. We were given menus, our server answered questions, made suggestions... The fried pickles were good and made in house! My wife had the Fried Egg Burger, loved it! I had the Southwest Burger, loved it! The beers on tap were some of the best! I'm surprised they had many good ones for a "Mom and Pop" place. The one thing I didn't like was watching many of the staff members including a female cook, interact with an older gentleman by the name Paul. They gave him a plate with chicken and tomatoes. However, they replaced the tomatoes multiple time with their bare hands. At first they were full sized regular tomatoes. They laughed as he ordered a chicken breast with sliced tomatoes. He clearly was given whole ones as a joke. However, they took the tomatoes with their bare hands and replaced them with grape tomatoes. Again, laughing at the joke of giving him the wrong tomatoes. Finally, the tomatoes were once again removed with bare hands from an employee and replaced with sliced ones. As a chef, many sanitation issues come to mind! Not to mention, the cook had her dirty apron on outside of the kitchen. Which is against the health code. I like the food, unfortunately, after seeing how the cook and employees handle food... I'm not sure I'd trust this place again.
Sat down at a table and waited for 10 min. Not a single server or employee noticed us. Went to tell the hostess and no one was around. How are they still in business? We left and won't come back.

Food was absolutely fantastic.  We started with nachos which were some of the best I've ever had.  Make sure to get chicken and carne Asada. Burger was cooked to perfection and girlfriends enchiladas were great too.  Had a good experience with the service as well.  

The only complaint I had was the cleanliness of the tables.  We were going to sit outside but tables were dirty and sticky.  The table we chose inside wasn't the best but they took care of it upon request.  Definitely would eat here again.

Great food and good service. We shared a hot Italian sandwich and chop salad. The western chop salad with chicken on the lunch menu was huge. Kudos to the waitress who made us feel special. We had a bit of a wait as the patio was full, but she made us feel like honored guests. Next time we will try the beers, but on our motorcycle so no booze. 
Wish there was a Harvey's in Tucson. Made our Saturday Harley ride and late lunch great.

Could have some potential but needs to tweak a couple things...

The patio is terrific and so is the ambiance inside the restaurant.  Two good points.

The food was okay.  We ordered the pork sandwich.  Nothing to write home about, but it wasn't bad and wasn't overpriced.  The fries had potential as well, but the batch we had was a little on the luke warm side.

Now on to the beer.  I was a little put off that it was 6 dollars for a pint.  There are numerous places close by that one can go and get a cheaper beer with better selection.  I hope they fix this...

The band that plays at night...meh...

All in all, there are some growing pains, but it may get better.  I am hopeful

Not much has changed at Harvey's APH over the past year ... but I'll kick it up one star for still being in business. 

The big plus, there's nothing else like it in the 'far' East Valley and they're open till 2am. (That's 5 stars in my book)

While I've yet to meet the same bartender or waitress twice, I really hope they figure it out as the Public House thing is a really cool concept.

Not good at all!   Food is horrible.  I've had in the past the burger which was ok.  but not impressed.  So I order out this time and they got it wrong.   I order the tuna sandwich that had one scoop of tuna on it and some chips, which I didn't order.  I order the salad.   I wouldn't recommend this place.  Blu 32 is way better next door!
Glad web had a groupon... won't be back. Good location, cute place, bad food and service. I asked the server how the ahi salad was and she said "I'm scared of it". Awesome.

what a disappointment.  A beautiful patio full of cigarette smoke.  Even the menus smell bad.  According to our waitress she re sat us in the "non smoking section of the patio" on the fake green grass.  This area is right next to the smokers and the bar is directly adjacent where patrons were smoking there, as well.  We then moved to the inside where unfortunately the onion rings we ordered were way over cooked and too greasy.  We just went for appetizers and wine.  Service was good but nothing else was.  What a poor business decision considering the area it is located in has far more non smokers than smokers.  I didn't even think it was legal in gilbert to allow smoking where food was being served but I must be wrong.  We won't be back.
Visited this place a few months ago and both the service and food was incredible. Going there again this week sometime. Can't wait.

The bad: Self seating left a small wait till we were noticed. Burgers were overdone.
The good: Interesting decor, casual fun atmosphere. Great iced tea. The house made potato chips and dip were fabulous. Lots of beer on tap.
Overall a good experience we will definitely be back!

Love this place!! My husband and I go all the time. Service is very good and the prices are great especially during happy hour. My favorites are the nachos and the strawberry salad. My husband has tried all the sandwiches and his favorite is the turkey club but they are all fantastic. Be sure to ask about the rewards card, they don't seem to advertise it, but it is free and you earn money every time you go. They also have the best beer choices. Definitely a place you need to check out.

Started outside at first and had great service, but with people smoking on the patio, it ruins it for those who don't smoke and are forced inside, or leave all together.  We chose to go inside.

Our new server was just as accommodating and we had a great time.  Nice beer selection and food was just as good.  Very clean atmosphere and the young man singing and playing guitar was awesome!

This place has a few kinks to work out.  That being said, the food was good.  Staff could use more training.  The patio is fantastic and large.  The indoor seating is adequate and fairly uncomfortable.  I understand the old american theming but the seats could use a little more padding.  Lots of beers on tap and sometime there is live music which definitely adds to the draw.  Will try again.

We've been here a few times prior to tonight, and have really enjoyed the food, patio, and overall experience. Tonight was absolutely horrible!! 

It was not that crowded, and we had a party of 7 plus an 11 month old, so getting to choose where to sit was great and we thought service would be good. Our server, James, seemed very low key, but with it at first. After ordering a round of drinks and an appetizer, we placed food orders at a reasonable time frame. The food was brought out about 30 minutes after ordering,  but only two plates were delivered by another server. She then brought three more, then asked what else we needed - well duh, the other two. 10 minutes goes by - no other plates delivered and no one has stopped by so we could ask. Another 5-7 minutes tick by, and we see the lady who delivered the food. We tell her we are still missing 2 dinner plates, and she says,"No one brought them yet?"  

Mind you our server, James, has not been seen in 20 minutes. All water glasses are empty, some wanted another round of drinks, and three people finished their meals before two people have even been served!! A woman, maybe an assistant manager, asked how things were when finally the other plates were brought. She half assed apologized- said they were backed up. (There were maybe 5 other parties in there!) A bit later, James comes and says they are short staffed- I'd hate to see them on a busy night!!! 

We never assume or would ask for a meal taken off our bill, but at least an offer to remove the appetizer (chips and salsa) would have been nice. No one there seemed to care that the service was abysmal. 

Plus, it took our server about 15 minutes to split the check- then had to come re-ask what everyone had! 

All in all, the food was good- minus the moderately warm late 2 plates. That is the only reason a star was even given. Sad, because we really used to like this place. 

Side note- it says kid friendly, but there is no changing station in the restroom.

Really delicious food and good service! The atmosphere was comfortable and relaxed...definitely locked down the nostalgia vibe they were going for. Everyone in our party loved what they ordered and I'm excited to try more on a future visit!!!
Had the Fsh and chips over here and it was pretty good but I was really here for the few places that have some music after dinner and really enjoy the music

I have not tried the food, but the bartenders are great and the service on the patio is good. They have great beer selection for a restaurant.

They also had a chalk board displaying what beers would be on tap next, which was a great way to lure me back!

This place is a nice atmosphere but I was really disappointed when evening. There's about 8 o'clock at night and the weather was beautiful. The back patio an open bar area is a really great place. Unfortunately the food was not. The food was very plain and you could definitely tell that the homemade chips had way too much salt on them to cover up that they had been sitting out for too long or the oil had not been changed. The same for the fish and chips. You can definitely tell that the oil had not been changed sitting out for too long or the oil had not been changed. The same for the fish and chips. You can definitely tell that the oil had not been changed. The drinks were OK, the martinis well flavored. I was just really looking forward to the homemade chips and dip. You could tell that the dip was really good probably at the beginning of the day and that the chips when they are fresh, are probably amazing. But this was a Friday night at 8 o'clock and everything tasted like it had been fried in the same oil and oversalted. We gone there for drinks in the atmosphere but not the food lately.

First impression today. Ice tea not fresh, but from the fountain. Yuk..  Chicken on a salad with strawberries $12.95! Too much money. Burgers start at $9.99!  I don't think this place will survive. Blue 32 has the sports, and the better menu. For me, I'm not returning.  For many, I think that they will go if Blue 32 is too busy.  The food turned out to be just OK.  The presentation average.  I would say it is worth a try if you like basic bar food, but overall, there are too many better places to go to continue to frequent here.  Time will tell.

Well, even though I said I would not be back, I do believe in second chances and decided to give Harvey's another try.  Completely different experience as we received great service from Kelli, dressed as a giraffe for halloween.  The food was awesome, both of us had burgers that are more than worthy of a return visit.  

We we're also checked on twice by a manager and the owner Frank who we shared our first experience with.  He made no excuses, just extremely grateful that we gave him another chance to prove they have come a long way.  They have a great patio area with a fire pit which we are now excited to frequent this winter.

The hubby and I had such a great lunch there we went back the very next day. Our server on the first trip, Andrea was incredible. Super attentive, made great recommendations  and our drinks were always full. They have an expansive craft beer list that they rotate. The burgers are huge 1/2 pounders with excellent fries or kettle chips. The chips come with a creamy onion sauce. The second trip the food was just as good but the service was a bit slower. We tried the turkey club and the roast beef sandwich.We will add this to our list of favorites.

Went here for the first time last night and I was very impressed! Had one of their burgers and it really hit the spot... my waitress was very attentive to our every need and the manager, I believe she said her name was Dawn, came by to make sure everything was perfect and even refilled our drinks for us! I have never had that before. Definitely worth the price and drive! This is definitely my new favorite place :)

We frequent this restaurant because they have a great patio and we have never had a bad meal. We have had burgers, chicken tenders, stroganoff, chicken caesar salad among other things. I am looking forward to trying this huge pot pie that I saw someone order the last time I was there.  I will say that we tried sitting at the bar one time and the service was horribly slow as 3 bartenders/waiters continually walked by with us without refilling drinks, bringing the check or picking up the payment. Service at the normal tables is exceptional and we were told that everything from the salad dressing to the noodles are made in house.
Food way to salty my cevechi was :( I mentioned it and expected it to be taken off the bill but  wasn't! Pretzel roll doughy on the ruben as well:(
Beer list has massively improved over the years.  Food has too.  Nice misted patio and live music in the evenings makes this a fun place to relax and enjoy time with friends.

Never understand the poor reviews here.  The French Dip is seriously the best I've ever had - don't pass up on the french fries either (go on your cheat day if you must).  

Great draft beer selection, great food ... what more are you looking for in a local eatery.  Yes - it can be slow at times but that's what the great beer selection is for. 

Quit reading and go eat already!

Great new addition to Gilbert.  I came in on a Wednesday night and there was live music, the patio was packed - large crowd for a Wednesday night.  I can tell this place is going to be a hit.  As soon as I walked in, I could smell freshly stained wood, it gave me the feeling that someone put a lot of hard work into building this place - unique and not prefabricated like most restaurants in Gilbert.

Good selection of beers on Tap, I had a Stella.  For apps, we split some ricotta balls.  They were delicious - breaded and fried to perfection and topped with a little marinara.  For dinner, I ordered the chicken caprese with fresh veggies and mashed potatoes.  I was a little disappointed.  I love caprese and make it at home often -  slices of tomatoes, basil and mozzarella - it's a great combo.  I expected the dish to have more caprese but it was basically chicken topped with a slice of mozzarella, two slices of tomato and a little basil.  Both the chicken and veggies were lacking in flavor.  The mashed potatoes however, were the best I've ever had in my life.  I want more!  I can't wait to go back and try some more items on the menu.... or maybe just get a big bowl of mashed potatoes.  

The service was good.  Ambiance was very nice.  Restrooms were clean.  Although, they had a sign that said "Let us know if the restrooms need attention"  and I didn't like it, I'm not an employee, if you want me to keep you posted on stuff going on in your restaurant, give me a free beer or something.  Otherwise, make sure the staff knows to scan the restroom once an hour.

Also, this is a great place for a large party of people.  There was a separate room off to the back that would make for a great rehearsal dinner or retirement party.

I have nothing special to report about my visit to this place.  The sandwich was ok, the appetizers were ok, the service was ok - but nothing impressed me other than the pretty bartender who looked a lot like Olivia Wilde.  I guess if you live near this place, and want to try it out, there's really no reason not to - but don't go out of your way.

Use their party room! They just did a wedding reception for close friends and it was outstanding! They had a dedicated server for the room- which is not always the case at other places but makes a huge difference! Brittany was attentive, friendly, and fast. The party size  was about 35 and the guests all have glowing reviews of the food and service. Since I helped with setting up the room (to decorate) I can attest to knowledgable staff, even the cooks could answer questions about party details! And they were extremely flexible with music, offered a screen and projector, and had a dedicated bathroom. I can't recommend this place enough!

No stars because I did not get to try anything. Quick run down

11 am-we sit down
11:17 - someone finally came over to serve us
11:30 - drinks finally come to our table
11:35 - table next to us walks out because they waited 20 minutes for drinks
11:48- server realized the food had not come to the table yet
11:55 - food comes out
11:56 - send food back
11:59 - walking over to Burger King 

My burger was burnt and my wife received the wrong food. Will Never Try This Place Again!!!!

So much I was not happy with this place. Came here for lunch with my wife for the first time.  She had a ruben on a pretzel bun, big mistake! You mostly taste pretzel then you do the meat. I had the chicken salad and it was ok. Had a seasoning we both couldn't  pick out, a little odd tasting. The "Iced tea" sits in a pitcher out in the open, warm, so it melts any ice in your glass instantly leaving you a warm iced tea. Seats we had is a long wooden bench and was not very comfortable. We both had a side salad. She had a Cesear and I had a garden with Blue cheese. My Blue cheese was runny and not very favorable. The salad plates are to small and flat, very hard to mix your salad dressing in , without your salad falling onto the table. There was just too much wrong with this visit to give them a second chance.......DOH!!!!!

Great place to go on Sunday afternoon. Carne Asada Nachos and very fresh and tasty. Fantastic bartenders and Happy Hour on Sunday is great!!! Fantastic beer selection from AZ Mudshark, Four Peaks, San Tan, Phoenix Ale, and many more!!!

I don't know what the other reviewer's were complaining about. Great service at the bar. You must try really hard to pour a bad beer. Food was good but I could not eat enough of it. Everything is made from scratch! We totally enjoyed everything we ordered. And I love that there is a patio for day drinking on nice days.

If I could give this place zero stars i would.  The service was horrendous and please beware of  the WAITRESS BRITTANY!  We were extremely rushed from the minute we sat down. Even though we were rushed they still took their time bringing out our drinks and food. While ordering we specifically asked for our appetizers to come out before our entrees but instead, everything came out at the same time. I ordered the Fried Egg burger and the plate was covered in ketchup (yes, you read that right).  The botom of the plate was dripping in kethcup and after I was handed the plate it splattered all over my clothes and legs. (We were sitting on the patio)  The server, BRITTANY, was extremenly unaplogetic and didnt seem to care for the inconveniences.  She was extremely rude, impolite, and should not be in the restaruant industry.  After the horrible service we still left her a more than generous tip that was not deserved.  We spoke to the manager, Frank, and he was very courteous and apologetic for what had happened. As far as recommending this place to anyone? The food is great and definetely above average but the service is horrendous. It's worth a try but beware of Brittany.
Even with special diet requests they hit the mark.  The service and food was average at the beginning when they opened, but they are getting better at each visit.

This place has a great patio and a good selection of beers on tap. Its a great casual place to come out get some food and a couple of cold ones. The live music on Friday and Saturday nights is also very cool. The reason I only gave it 3 stars is because they also have a rewards club card which you earn points on every visit, but out of the 12+ times that I've been here, they are always out of the cards. By this point I would have already had a hefty amount of points on the card. Also, the bathroom doesn't have a mirror which is a bit strange.

Food recommended: Reuben, Chicken tenders, Onion Rings

We eat at Harvey's a lot. They have great homemade food and fresh cut frys and chips with great seasoning. Great burgers and sandwiches. The prices are good and you get a lot of food. They also have a lot of different things going on that will keep you entertained.   It's more of a bar type atmosphere but its a great place to eat.

This is a usual spot for my friends and I for the past few years. Service is known to be pretty slow, but we are patient people and still continue to return. Our server last night was great though, probably one of the best ones we have had there. Now I am not easily bothered, but what I saw occur last night did not sit right with me, especially being in management of a restaurant chain myself. We wanted to order some food, but we were told the kitchen was closed...no big deal. A group sat next to us about 20-30 mins after we noticed them ordering food(with a different server). We brushed it off thinking maybe they were going to be told the same thing. Then all of a sudden food is being delivered to them after we had been told otherwise. It was just incredibly rude and a huge slap in the face. I had asked our server what was going on and she told me that they "bribed" the kitchen and paid them to cook their food. What?! That's just unheard of and so unprofessional.
Back again. We've been seeing good adjustments. The service and food quality are back to good levels. The nanager is walking the floor. Beer is in stock.

Came here on Friday night with a pretty big group. They were very nice to let us use their party room since our group grew beyond the number of our original reservation (26).  

Service was great. There was only one guy serving our whole crew. He did awesome at keeping drinks full and checking in on us for other needs. It felt like he had a whole staff helping him when it was just himself working our section. 

Food was pretty good too. The fish and chips looked great! I will try that next time. 
I got the fried egg burger. Cook was nice (mid rare) and fries were great. My only complaint is that the egg is cooked over medium and there was not much yoke.  In my opinion, it should have been over easy so that the yoke pours out when cut into. 

I also tried the chips and dip. Great home cooked chips with onion dip. Great flavors and textures. 

The carne asada nachos were very tasty. Not Mexican in any way, but very good. There was a sweetness to the nachos and they were also a little spicy. 

Just as we were getting leave, a band showed up. Turns out that they have live music on Friday nights. 

Parking is scarce, so get here early to get a spot.

The parking lot was full on an early Friday night. We were impressed on the volume of people to the area.  Asked the hostesses to be seated, she asked my preference inside or outside. She gave us our seating time for outside and were seated as promised. 
After being seated 2 waitresses asked if were ready to order.  Which is a good think they want to serve their customers.  After a bit Ellie came by to check on us. Ellie was very helpful pointing out some favorite beers. She was very patient and attentive taking our orders.  I tried the flight beer tasting which was a great recommendation from Ellie. Found some great beers thank to Ellie. Our food was a little slow in coming surprisingly we were served a side of chips while we waited. Which was greatly appreciated.  Our food was worth waiting for we had French dip and the Cuban sandwich.  The whole experience was great!   The beers we tried are Guinness Blonde, Vanilla Porter, Wasatch Apricot, Pumpkin Ale, Iron Fist Stout  I highly recommend this place if you want to have good beer great food and wonderful experience with friends!!!

I've been here a few times and have had mixed impressions. A pleasant environment with a nice outdoors seating with a well crafted fireplace. They have mugs you can keep there and the staff are friendly enough. Not always there on the service but hey it's more of bar anyways. They have live music sometimes which is always appreciated.
The food is delicious and the beer selection is good too. I had the dry rubbed pork ribs. Stone IPA was really good too.

I just came back from opening night at Harvey American. It was their first night so I tried to give them some slack, but it was just too horrible and I quickly ran out of slack. Their "garlic fries" consisted of a plate full of greasy soggy fries with a clump of ground garlic thrown on top. Had to ask the waitress for napkins, utinsels, condiments, and remind her that I ordered a beer. The place is right next to Blue 32 which ALWAYS has excellent food and service. So I was a little surprised that they'd open with such a poorly trained wait staff and such sub-par food.  I may give it another shot in about 6 months to see if they got their act together...we'll see. 
For now though, they better go back to the drawing board.

I've only been here a few times, and I really like it. The beer selection is amazing, and their food is good. After their kitchen closes they have a solid cheese and meat board, just ask for more toasted bread!
Egg burger is outstanding!!!! Came here with the family and couldn't be more impressed!!! Will eat here again!
Great place. Took them a bit to get going, but they are serious about creating an awesome local friendly watering hole.

Love Love Love this place! Fantastic atmosphere and great food.  I was very impressed with the service my husband and I received from our server, Tricia.  She was quick, courteous, knowledgable and just overall very pleasant.  I would highly recommend this establishment.
Average at best... Empty @ 12:30 on a weekday for lunch.... Fries may be cut fresh but limp & soggy

EXCELLENT atmosphere, service, and food!

My boyfriend and I weren't sure about this restaurant based on the Yelp reviews, which turned out to be totally misleading. Do not judge this restaurant by the false and misleading reviews. Check it out for yourself. You won't be disappointed!

Our first impression was the atmosphere, which was very inviting. Personally, I love all the natural wood. They could work on the decor though, as it seemed a little disjointed.

We sat at the bar and were immediately greeted by a friendly, attentive bartender. Not only did the bartender ask if we wanted something to drink - He asked what our preferences were, and suggested drinks based on that. He was spot-on with the suggestions, and even made a 'blend' of tap beers that suited my taste perfectly.

We then ordered food. I chose the Ruben Sandwich, which was made with coleslaw instead of sauerkraut, on a pretzel bun. I hesitated at first, never having a Ruben made with coleslaw, but was told that the Ruben was delicious, and the pretzel bun made it even better - so I decided to give it a try. 

I substituted fries for a side salad, but was hesitant on which dressing to choose. Not even knowing I preferred lighter dressings, the bartender suggested the vinaigrette. The salad came quickly and was fresh and delicious - with all veggies cut into small pieces, making it easy to eat and enjoy. Not only was the vinaigrette delicious, it was put in a separate small dish, giving me the option as to how much I wanted to add to my salad.  

The Ruben sandwich was delicious. The thinly cut corned beef was piled high, and the coleslaw and thousand island dressing complimented it perfectly. The pretzel bun was warm and soft, a perfect of 'bread' for the Ruben. My boyfriend ordered the American Cheddar Burger with fries, and he was not disappointed, saying it was one of the best burgers he's had, and he enjoyed the fries too - which were tasty and not greasy.

Our overall experience and first impression of Harvey American Public House: Inviting atmosphere; Friendly staff  - the bartender AND two friendly wait persons who just got off work and sat next to us; Quick service; Delicious food! I would only suggest they work on the decor to make it less barren and disjointed - something that will compliment their style.

We were very impressed and will definitely be going back, and may very well become regulars!
Great food and fabulous service. Wonderful atmosphere. Servers and bartenders were off the hook with service. Tricia is the best! A must try!

Neat setting, very rustic and original.  Lots of great beers on tap, their blood orange margarita seemed to be very popular as well.  They have a pretty decent menu too.  I usually have the French dip and have never been disappointed.  The only thing semi-negative is the attentiveness of their servers.  They all too often seem  to congregate and chat around the bar well.

After two trips to Harvey American Public House, I think three starts is a fair rating. The first time I went there was with a larger party. Our service was not terrible, but was still lacking some personable traits. Personally, when my server is nice and friendly and doesn't mind chatting about the small things, I think it makes the experience a little better. Now, this place is busy, I get it (I used to wait tables too). Server's don't have all of the time in the world to chit chat, but at least asking how I am doing or something small like that would have made a difference. The food during the first visit was good. I don't recall having any complaints. My boyfriend's mom, who was one of the guests there with me, really enjoys this place because of the rotating tap and seasonal beers that they have on draft. This visit, I would say was pretty successful. 

The second visit was just a few nights ago. Our server was not attentive and when I ordered a beer it took 10+ minutes for her to bring it out to me. There were two bartenders behind the bar. Now, again, they were busy, however I know that the beer had been poured much sooner than she had brought it to me, because by the time I received it, it had NO head and was starting to get warm. I don't know if any of you have had a vanilla caramel porter before (VERY DARK BEER) but when it starts to get warm, it starts to get nasty. I ended up not even drinking the whole thing because it was so gross and basically unbearable to drink. We ordered some of the nachos that they serve. I understand that this is not a Mexican restaurant, so I didn't expect them to be insanely delicious, however, I ended up thinking that they just plain bad. The chicken on the nachos was dry, the chips were stale, and they were so spicy I could barely choke them down. Luckily, one of my friends who was there with me really liked the spiciness of them and ate the nachos. I decided to get the risotto balls because I was still starving. These were delicious. If there is one thing that HAPH is doing PERFECTLY, it's those risotto balls. 

The atmosphere of the restaurant is good. They constantly have live entertainment which is pretty cool, but a lot of country music. SO if you aren't a fan of country (just like I'm not) then you may want to steer clear of the times when live entertainment is there.

The food was simply amazing. I had the fried fish and the batter was light and crispy. My husband had the grilled wings and loved that they came with the sauce on the side.

The service was quite a bit different. We waited 10 minutes to get seated by the host, there was plenty of seating available, but maybe no one wanted to wait on us I'm not sure. It's like the host was trying to find a waiter that would take us. We considered leaving it took so long.

Our waitress was attentive at first, then not so much. The food came out hot and in a decent amount of time.  We were checked on maybe one other time by her. A manager or someone else stopped by and we ordered a beer, it finally came 10 minutes later. Then the manager stopped by again and cleaned our table, and then we sat there for another 15 before the waitress would bring us our bill.

Hopefully the service issues will be resolved soon... from the other reviews I can see it's been an issue for awhile.

We had to wait over 30 minutes to be served a couple of burgers. No wait at the door. Then when we received order things were not cooked as requested. 
Had to send back . So all told from time we sat down it rock about 50 minutes to get our order complete. Lots of choices in the area !! I think I'd look to one of them next time.

We visited this place when Blue 32 was too busy. The place was packed and hard to find a seat. We each got some burgers and absolutely loved them. The biggest disappointment was the service. The place seems to be understaffed. There was a point where it seemed like I waited close to 30 minutes to get another beer after I ordered it. Seems like the place could be managed much better. They are throwing away money by not providing more service and turning tables faster. We will be back, but if the poor service continues, there are just too many options in that area to go to.

We have now been to Harvey American Public House Twice. I only give it  2 stars for the beer selection, would have been a 1 without the selection. The food for the most part has been good. But only being here twice we have not been able to try a wide range of the food. The service has been subpar at best. Both times we have waited at least 15min to get  someone to take a drink order, then another 15min to place a meal order and then 20-30min for the food to come out. We had to find our waitress each time to get a water refill, only 1 refill each time we were there as the 1 refill was difficult enough. Both times we were there it was not crowded(at least 6-10 open tables), so no excuse for them there. In my opinion from what I observed, is that they are very focused on the regulars. We observed many times throughout both visits a group of waiters/waitresses at the bar talking for long periods to the bartender and folks setting at the bar. They were doing this in 10-15 min periods and people were waiting to be waited on. My last and finally breaking point was the smoking allowed on the patio and at the outside part of the bar. The first time we sat on the patio not realizing that smoking was allowed. So the next time we sat inside at the bar but it really did not matter as it was just as strong a smell and feel of smoke as the outside. The reason for this is the outside part of the bar is just a big window opening to the outside from the inside bar. I had thought that in Gilbert this type of smoking was not allowed, but guess I was wrong. Will not even try again due to the smoking situation.

Can only comment on the (non) attentive service.  Came in on a whim while holiday shopping in the area and were greeted and told to sit anywhere we liked.  That was the last we saw of any service person.  We waited about 20 minutes until a table of guys near us hailed a passing waitress and pretty much demanded their already ordered beers!  The place wasn't busy and there appeared to be 2 service personnel (hostess or waitress) chatting up the bartender.  Interesting concept with their yearly Mug Club but unfortunately for the owner, we won't be back to try it out.

The food here is awesome--I'd give five stars for that. I got the chopped southwest salad and it was great. The fries, burgers, and sandwiches that my family got were also good.

I had two issues here though. The first was the smoking. Seriously, at least the patio area is like sitting in a cigarette and it was disgusting. I'm not sure if it is non-smoking indoors.. at this point I thought non-smoking was a law so I didn't even think to be ask to be seated in a non-smoking section. They should probably mention that the seating area is smoking since that is not the norm anywhere else anymore.

Second issue was the service initially. We waited about five minutes to have our drink order taken and then waited for ten minutes, drink-less, until the manager arrived and apologized. After that the service was fine. Our new waiter seemed super rushed and brisk, but the place was crowded so I guess it was okay. It just was kind of stressful the way he was rushing around. The manager was super nice though and checked in a few times to make sure everything was okay. So I feel like they were aware of the service issue and did their best.

So yea overall, awesome food.. gross smoke.. maybe I'll see if they offer to-go? Otherwise I think I'd spare my lungs.

I was very hopeful for this place... and still am, but the have some work to do. This area is in need of more options like this, things to do later at night. Went with a group of friends a few weeks after their opening. (Maybe a month?) Maybe they need a little more time...

The Good: great atmosphere, lots of drink options, lots of beers on draft. Live music. Jalapeno burger got two thumbs up from our group.

The Bad: our server did okay, but wasn't very knowledgeable and was incredibly SLOW. The place wasn't even busy. Drinks are a little spendy.

The Ugly: All of the food, minus the jalapeno burger. The Italian Beef sandwich is tough, dry and almost inedible. Fries were very cold, but don't worry they are overly seasoned and you can get a thimble of cole slaw instead. Then there's the chef's favorite sandwich, which is described as ham and cheese with chopped apple compote and noted as being served on a pretzel bun, WRONG. It was basically ham and cheese with apple pie filling on a unidentified dry bun. It came out with a hole on top as if someone had taken a bite out of it. Our group was laughing about this when a manager, who must have been nearby and overheard, came out with a bun top and handed it to me. REALLY? What was that?

Again I have hopes for this place, they just need to work out the food situation and maybe get a few better servers. (Take a note from Oregano's, they do service right over there. ) Maybe would go back for drinks and music...
No one acknowledged us.   It was dead. Red wine came in a freezing glass????   Could not find our waitress to pay the bill   When she did come, she seemed annoyed .   Ugh.   Would never go back!!!!

Food was really good, I had the rueben on a pretzel bun. My date had fish tacos that she raved about. Lots of great beer and wine options with an awesome outdoor bar and patio seating. Happy hour 7 days a week till 7pm with specials daily, yes I will be back!

Visited on Sunday for the prime rib special,and we were seated right away.Was greeted by our server(Eddie)who took our drink order.Took a few minutes to get our beers as he was waiting tables on the patio as well.ordered the grilled wings for an app,and were great.We didn't see our server for a while after apps arrivedThe prime rib was good,but it seems that our server forgot to bring us our salads,and any bread during our meal.Food is good,but they need to straighten out the service,as once people start filling the dining room,it is to difficult to wait tables inside and out.

Went in on a Friday evening, was seated promptly but then waited over 10 minutes to even get acknowledged by a server. Place was not to busy but the service was BAD. Food was OK but the prices steep even during happy hour.   Won't be back when there are so many options in the area.

After our first visit last night, I'm going to give Harvey's the benefit of the doubt and go four stars but that may change with future visits. 

We started splitting a wedge salad, then had the Club and the Cuban. All very good. Then the place got a little busier and the service went a little south. Only two desert choices this night, the pizza cookie or the bread pudding. Kind of in the mood for something, and seeing nothing special about the cookie, we went with the bread pudding. We waited at least 20 minutes for it and it was ok at best, to us. Bread pudding can be very different at different places. I appreciated that it was over the top sickly sweet or drenched in sauce but it was too far the other side, dry, chewy and bland. It's a tough niche, the upscale pub where some are just drinking but families are welcome. We had fun and will try again but go elsewhere for desert after.

Oh boy, where to start with this place. Worst service EVER & the sad part is it was 1130pm on a Saturday night & there was no one actually sitting inside the restaurant  or bartop, only a few people outside. Sat at the bartop inside & there was three bartenders (two stocking the bar and one serving  peeps outside) 15 minutes go by & not one staff member says anything to even aknowledge us. So we start to get up & walk out then all of a sudden the bartender says, oh hey guys can i help you. REALLY? He was just shootin the shit with the other staff members goofing around & i literally couldn't  believe it. Crappy staff (esp bartenders) & food was crappy as well. Dont waste your  time!

The service has declined significantly. Last night was awful.  We never saw our server, even when we asked for water he wouldn't bring it. I had to give them my license for a Moscow mule, the copper mugs keep walking away. He forgot to bring it back when I cashed out. We didn't get plates for the appetizers. The first Moscow mule didn't have ginger beer. Not as good as it used to be...

went there with my son and my fiance for the first time.  I will say that it is a true Irish pub house and probably not the best place for a kid but since we went in the middle of the day my son enjoyed it.  My son did get entertained by looking at the pictures, posters and antique items they have in cases and books as well. The food was delicious and honestly great sizes as we all had leftovers.  I got the salad (delicious) my fiance got the pizza and my son got chicken tenders.  They make all of the sauces home made 

downfall - took a while to get fed in the middle of the day with only 6 people in the restaurant 

Will definitely return as they have Guiness on TAP!

Have eaten here several times and generally the food is pretty good. Not great, but good for a beer and burger place. The reason for the two stars is the wait staff. The last few times we have gone in we are met with an attitude of indifference at the door that seems to permeate the wait staff. Waited a long time to for our first contact with the waitress, though she was pleasant. Seems she had customers on the patio as well as inside and was spread thin, so it was a long time between visits. First beer came timely,  but could not get the attention of anyone for a refill when our food came. A different waitress dropped off our food (and that was literally what she did) and quickly turned away and did not ask if we needed anything else. Furthermore, she went out of her way to avoid our conspicuous attempts to get her attention for something we needed. In the meantime our first waitress was busy on the patio and, apparently, waitress #2 was not happy that she had to serve us our food, because she continued to ignore our attempt to get her attention, even glaring and looking through me at one point. Although this was "Trivia night" (for the life of me I don't understand what a restaurant gets out of this since most participants seem to only buy drinks), the place was not crowded or busy and there seemed to be plenty of employees to go around the room and tend to the customers that were present. This is only an account of the third bad experience we have had with service. There have been others, interspersed with satisfactory experiences. 
We both have many years in the restaurant business and our assessment of the reason for this uneven experience falls on management. First, choose people that are committed to the success of your business. There are many competitors out there waiting to take your place if you stumble. Second, management has the responsibility to make certain staff is well schooled in how to deal with customers, including the technique of scanning the room and making eye contact with those that seem to be looking for something. There are usually additional sales involved in doing this competently. Third, management needs to be present and observant so that when it is apparent things are not going well, they can do what they are paid to do, i.e. make it right. You only get so many bites at this apple HAPH, so you better get it right or Gilbert ends up with yet another vacant building with a "For Lease" sign in the window.

I really do try to go into a new restaurant with an open mind but with the service and so-so burger we received on August 11th, I can't help but give a not-so-good review. I have had several friends try this place out and they had favorable experiences so I thought I would give this place a shot. I consider myself a "localvore" and I only dine at local businesses. When I saw that we were getting a new public house in Gilbert we were excited to try something new. The atmosphere of the restaurant seemed nice even though it was dead quiet when we went. Loved the wood furnishings and the open floor plan. I figured that since this was a public house, the draft beer selection was pitiful. They have the Left Hand Stout and the Alaskan Amber Ale on draft and thats about all thats worth talking about  i cannot believe that they are not featuring any of our local breweries. 

The hubby and I ordered the mozzarella risotto balls for an appetizer but never got to try them as the server never entered the order in. When we received our burger and sandwich we asked the server about the appetizer and she just said that she forgot to enter it in.  Not sure how that happened considering we ordered our daughter's grilled cheese at the very same time. I don't know if she just wasn't focused or what, it was disappointing because I really wanted to try them. We elected to just forgo the appetizer so we could enjoy or main dishes. I ordered the Blue Cheese Burger which very much lacked the blue cheese. It was essentially a dry bacon burger. The hubby ordered the Reuben sandwich which was amazing. If I ever HAVE to go back, I will order the Reuben. The server also neglected to bring us ketchup with our fries and at that point I was done. Just wanted to finish the sandwiches and get out of there. 

It makes me sad to write a 2-star review but after the experience we had this weekend, I felt I really had to. Management needs to address the customer service issues and more craft brews need to be featured, otherwise I think of this place as another Applebee's.
Wings are grilled!  Lots of beers to choose from!  Nachos and wedge salad were amazing. Great casual atmosphere. Came two nights in a row was so good.

Gosh this place has amazing potential! First of all, the restaurant itself has appeal. The patio is great and the interior is open and welcoming. Customer service was great. Our waiter was knowledgable and attentive and really seemed to care about our lunch (and beer), which may I add that their beer list was great. Now for the food. The fried pickles were the best we've had. Instead of the typical cornmeal breading, these were thick pickles with a crisp batter that was not too heavy. The chipotle sauce on the side was a perfect accompaniment too. 

For entrees,my husband ordered the fried egg burger which he enjoyed. The bun was nice and the bacon was thick and crisp. No complaints there. My ribeye sandwich, however left something to be desired. I guess I was picturing chopped steak, but the sandwich was a chewy slab of steak, which though perfectly cooked medium, was so difficult to eat because it was sandwiched between huge pieces of focaccia. I appreciate that they make their own focaccia but this sandwich just didnt make any sense and could've been better. We both had the fries for our side, and they were covered with a seasoning that we couldn't place (thyme? rosemary?). Just some salt would've been nice! 

Like I said, this place has great potential. Customer service was excellent, the restaurant itself is very nice, beers were cold and the food was decent. Just a few tweaks and it will be success. We will return :)

I've gone once. Decor is strange with a lot of wood accents and walls everywhere. I get that public houses are making a surge now but the menu is pretty plain and service was sub par, even on a Saturday afternoon when there must have been less than 8 people in the entire establishment.

I ordered the classic cheddar burger. It was cooked right, but had minimal flavor. The cheese sauce was thick, tasteless and made the entire sandwich messy. The fries were okay. Diet coke was from a bar tap and was flat. 

My 18 month old daughter got the kids menu chicken fingers and they were super greasy. Almost too greasy to even eat. 

Overall I understand why the slow start. There are lots of opportunities two improve the diner's experience with this place. For what I paid I would expected a much better experience. There's a sandwich shop next door-- same ownership and masthead  it we have yet to try that. Maybe another time.

Went on a Thursday night it was not busy. Ordered a local beer and was told by the bartender with the accent that we need to get away with that trend. He served me another beer. Unfortunately I did not like it and ordered a bottled domestic. Bottom line service sucked! I mean big time! I will not go back to the bar! Positive note I ordered the fried pickles and they were so good! I would come back for them. But will not sit at the bar if the arrogant little man is there!
Sometimes little long to wait but overall worth it! Large selection on tap and the food is amazing!! Great place! Would recommend to anyone to try out!! Also have  live music on some nights!

Stopped by here for lunch with some coworkers. It was a slow afternoon and we decided to sit outside (nobody out there). The patio is spacious and well maintained, with an bar open to the inside of the restaurant. Service was a bit slow, especially bringing the food out. Some of the dishes were clearly sitting out for a while (read cold food). I had an apple salad with goat cheese, figs, and a delicious dressing. It was really good, but too small even for a lunch portion. I might give it one more try, but my first go around was a fail.

Not the worse experience but right up there. Several empty tables but we were told it would be 25 min wait. Got some beers from the bar (that is why I gave them one star) and sat at a reserved table waiting to be called. Finally ask the hostess why we could not have one of the empty tables and she finally got is seated. Ordered an  appetizer and it was delivered by a kid who placed it on the table and split the sauce and then walked away. Had to ask for plates and napkins and to please clean up the mess he made. We got plates and he took the napkins to clean up the mess and never came back with napkins. Appetizers and dinner were flavorless (ordered the Cuban and fish and chips). I will say that the pumpkin bread pudding was awesome (that was the second star). We have not been to Harvey's in a while and now I know why. So unless you just want a cold beer and desert I would not suggest this place. Go to blue 32 next door.

Bottom line: Great setting and atmosphere, ok food, horrible service.  Its a shame sine this place has a lot of potential. Four of use came in at 10:30 on Saturday night. Place wasn't busy. We wanted to sit near the fireplace on the patio. Only table was one that hadn't been cleared though there was only about a dozen folks outside. We sat down and were there for almost 15 mins with servers walking around and no one stopped at the table. One of our party finally got up and grabbed a menu from inside the bar. Finally, we flagged down a server and he picked up half the bottles on the table and left the rest. Another long wait and a second server shows up for our drink order. That takes another 10 minutes before they come and the rest of the table is cleaned. A third server shows up and tells us we are his table and he'll be taking care of us. We get the obligatory "I'm the only one working" apology. He is the only reason this place gets a star. We order two plates of wings and fries. Again another 15 minute wait. Other servers were complaining about work conditions in earshot of our table. Bartender was another bright spot. Oh, and did I mention the water all over the floor in the men's room? Fall lawsuit waiting to happen. This place was a mess. It's too bad because they have a lot of potential. Owner needs to clean house and get a staff that actually has some experience, desire, and positive attitude.

Couldn't agree more with the latest reviews. Unless you enjoy being ignored, stay away from this place. We live right behind It and used to go often when they first opened. Now it is like being invisible when you walk in. I hear that the lunch service is ok,, but we were ignored for 20 minutes last week on a Tuesday night. The place was over 1/2 empty, and when the "hostess" finally acknowledged us, she said it would be 1/2 hour before she could seat is because they only had one server.  I guess that meant they were only allowing 4 tables to be open.  Sheez.  
Ok so they do have a very nice outdoor patio area, and if you don't mind getting your own drinks, it's a nice place for good conversations. The only problem there is getting the bartenders attention, which, unless your blonde, female, and nearly topless, is going to take some time.  

Sorry Harvey American, you've nose dived and I don't see y'all being able to pull out of it.

The food was decent but the service makes me never want to go again. It was so slow first of all and our waitress was visibly not busy. We had a group of 8 and it took WAY too long to get our (cold) food, get our empty cups refilled and get out checks. The server looked kind of annoyed the whole time (we're not a loud or rude group), and she never once smiled. I understand people can have a bad day, but the icing on the cake is when we FINALLY got the checks they had 20% gratuity added on! I know with groups most places add gratuity and that's fine, but there is no way I would have voluntarily tipped more than 15% for that service. I will definitely not be back.

Story time... 

I live right across the street from Harvey's and have always contemplated going inside. Finally one summer night after coming home from a D-backs game my gf, puppy and I decided to roll on over for a late night beer. Here is where the disappointment begins

At the front door there is a sign that says please seat yourself. No biggie, we sit down in a corner area so as not to disrupt other patrons considering we have our adorable english bulldog who loves public attention. We wait 5-10 minutes and no one comes to acknowledge we are even there. There goes a star. 

Still thirsty, I go to the bar and wait another 4-5 minutes until the bartender finally meanders over and does not even say hello, how are ya, what's going on. nothing.. She just LOOKS AT ME. Boom we're down to 3 stars. 

Next she get gets me the drinks and when I ask for a few waters on a 105 degree phoenix night I am given attitude. 2 stars it is. ....

Well, they tell us our puppy is not allowed and we are down to the final Star.

I will not be back. The service blows and so does the no puppy on the patio policy (alliteration intended)

My husband and I have been waiting for this place to open.  The area is seriously lacking in decent late night entertainment choices we were happy to hear they were going to be open late and offer live entertainment.

It is still a relatively short time since they opened so we expected some service issues, especially with what I had read on here prior to dropping by.  That being said ,yes, there are areas for improvement, however we had a decent visit and I will definitely return again.

We arrived about 10:30 on a Thursday night so the "late night" menu was the only option for food.  We were disappointed to learn later that the kitchen stops serving at midnight.  I would have been nice for the kitchen to be open later. We sat at the outdoor portion of the bar.  The ambiance was great and with the misters it was very comfortable.  They had a two man guitar duo playing and it was a nice background on a chill Thursday night.  But, again, we were disappointed when the band packed up at 11.  Maybe it was because it was Thursday but the patio was packed and I guarantee if they kept the music going until at least midnight people would have stuck around longer.

Beer selection is good.  They offer some decent craft selections and had OK happy hour prices - not the best but we didn't break the bank either.  The bartender was friendly but a little slow.  The crowd wasn't super huge so maybe he's still adjusting to the next bar set up. He was attentive for the most part and service wasn't unbearable. He made it a point to ask our names so i would guess he quickly gets to know the regulars.

Slow is the norm though it seems as it took about 30 minutes to get our food we ordered.  BUT, the food we tried was excellent.  I was very surprised actually.  We opted for the appetizer sampler platter which had a couple risotto balls, chicken tenders, onion rings and grilled wings.  All the food was excellent.  The chicken tenders were obviously freshly battered and cooked perfectly.  I'm not usually a huge fan of these as they remind me of a cheap kids meal but it had us wanting to order more which is why we were disappointed the kitchen closed so early.  The onion rings - black and tan - were also very flavorful and done perfectly - not too crispy and not greasy.  The risotto ball were OK.  I liked them but didn't care for the marinara being already on them.  Would have liked having it on the side better.  The star in my mind however were the grilled wings.  The grilled flavor tasted just like they came off a backyard BBQ.  We ordered the jerk sauce however they came out plain by mistake (the bartender comped us for this error without us even having to mention it) but I think that was a good mistake because the flavor shined through so well without the sauce.  I'll try them with the sauce next time but given the grilled flavor I can see order them plain and then dipping in the sauce to my liking. 

We will definitely be back again and hopefully the next time will be even better.  I do urge them to think "later" though - keep the music going later and serve the food later - even on weeknights.

My husband and I went for lunch.  He had the Pot Roast Sandwich that could have been ordered at any fast food sandwich shop.  The side of fries that were ordered were seasoned.  I had the Ham with the pretzel bun.  The sandwich was good, but again, any fast food place would've been just as good.  The side I chose was coleslaw.  Again, this was typical and nothing special.  Our total for lunch $35.00.  My suggestion, go to Blue 32 next door or in the same plaza, check out Gino's.  You'll get more bang for your buck.
Great bar food and drinks. I love to go on Wednesdays to play trivia with friends where you can win prizes! Also tacos are half off that night which is what I would recommend. Also great dessert!!!!

Love this place.  

I've been a few times and can't believe I've never written a review.  Harvey's is Gilbert's own Gastropub.  They have great food with great beer choices.  They usually rotate their taps so to always nice to try a different beer than you otherwise wouldn't get a chance to and a normal bar.  

They have live music on weekends which is usually a full band.  It can get a little loud in there but save the conversations for the park and just enjoy the atmosphere.  

I've had the joy of coming here during St Pattys day and usually the chandler/Gilbert Irish band will stop by and play their bag pipes for about 30+ min.  Trust me if you've never had this opportunity to hear them you MUST.  It's indescribably amazing.  

P.S.  The Fried Egg Burger will put you in a oh so worth it food coma.

10:30am - 2:30pm. The deli side is open!  They have the best sandwiches!  I recommend the ham and cheese on pretzel bread or the turkey and avocado.  As soon as you step in Eugene makes you feel welcome, is helpful and genuinely glad to serve you!

Came with several friends to see Chuck E Baby and his band perform - Chuck is an amazing talent and always entertaining. Check him out if you have the opportunity.  Started off with drinks (my friend had a Bloody Mary that was off hook!).  Went on to appetizers of risotto balls and nacho's.  Both were excellent, but those risotto ball are outrageous! Entrees were, southwest chopped salad, strawberry salad, salmon salad and a turkey club sandwich.  Everyone was happy with their choices which came out quickly and well-prepared.  Only thing that stopped me from rating at 5 stars was that there seemed to be a lot of confusion on the part of the "runners" with what food went to which table.   I'll definitely be back.

I hate writing this review since we've been coming here from the time they opened. We used to love Harvey's, but now the new management and staff have really turned this place into a dump. The happy hour isn't that great anymore, but the worst part is the staff. We came in last night for dinner and drinks. While we were finishing our last beer the waiter asked for us to pay, took our signed bills, and then 5 minutes later asked if we would either leave or go outside since they have a current wait for tables (while they had 4 opens tables!). Not to mention, the waiter never refilled out waters, never checked on us until the end, and he grabbed fruit for our drinks with bare hands. I spoke to the manager and he said he would follow up back up with me, which never happened. I wouldn't waste my time or money at this place. There's plenty of other good restaurants around that area.

This is definitely first on the list when we discuss where we would like to go for some food and a drink, plus is walking distance to Fox's Cigar bar.  We have always had great service and the food is always yummy.

My daughter comes here often for trivia so I wanted to give the fries she always brags about a try! Great pub atmosphere, great fish tacos with pineapple salsa, hit or miss service, hit or miss fries! The first visit the fries were 6 starts! Garlic, gooey goodness. The second time, the garlic was no where to be found and they were just eh. The prices for happy hour are great and ok for other times. Great selection of beers but for a pub they are frequently out of several selections and don't update the "this is the beer list for today menu." My daughter went through three on the list before finding one they were not out of. The patio is a great spot with a fire pit etc and will be fantastic in the fall.

Been here for happy hour a few times, but haven't tried the food. Drink service is usually pretty quick and I've never run into the common annoyances like asking for water or the check multiple times waiting for it to show up.

Nice patio space, but it can get a little warm if you're not near a mister

I stopped in Harvey's American House on Saturday while my wife was shopping across the street at Koles.  As soon as I sat down a very energetic young lady sticks out her hand and asked my name.  Her name is Fianna, enthusiasm and great outgoing personality is a great asset to the owner of this place a lot of beers on hand, no Guiness to my surprise had Murphy's Stout.  Food looked appetizing and can't wait to go back for a meal. I hope Fianna will be working, she lights the place up.

We love this place !  Service is always good, friendly and professional.  The food is amazing. It is very obvious that quality product is used as we have never had a bad meal here.  The live music is good, always a different group so you never know what to expect, but that's a plus if you ask me. 
Now here is the funny thing..... I drink Moscow Mules.... a month or so ago I was at the bar and ordered one, the bartender told me he would need to hold my ID as some of their copper mugs were getting stolen, and they are very expensive.  I gave it up thinking that it was odd, but  whatever.  Then as I was getting into my car I realized I forgot to ask for it back and had to go back in and ask for it.  The more I thought about it I started to feel insulted and offended.  The only message this act sends to your guests is that your mug is more important than your customer.  So, this past weekend when we went in.... I ordered.... and was asked to hold my ID, I just said put it in a normal glass.  Problem solved.  It's obvious that it is awkward for the server to have to ask to hold the ID. We love this place so I've decided not to let it bother me, but I can only imagine how many guests will be so offended they won't return.
Went for dinner tonight great time. Fun trivia night. Food was good as always. Wait staff very nice. We will be back soon.

Wife and I tried this new place, food was great, service was quick! They need a little time  to get settled in but this place is going to be special. We will be going back! They had this ham sandwich was pretty killer, the wife said the salad was good too.

The special -Cajon pasta great! Add chicken  
Chicken enchilada also really good. 
Fun time good service. Have not been here but a few times before - it will be a first choice next time we go out. Keep it up! Good food and beverage options.

I went here once and they had a deal for a burger and fries.  They burger was average to me but it is a good deal for the amount of food you get.  I really like the brews this place had on tap when I was there and look forward to trying other items here in the future.

I was there last night may 8th around 9pm to listen to a band I like to follow.  Short story I'll never go back. 

The place was no busy I was just the 4th person at the bar yet two bartenders on duty... Should have had excellent customer service right?   Nope. 

I had one beer and asked for a menu,  given one but was never asked if I wanted anything.   I was obviously an interpretation to this lady bartender social hour.   I had to ask her to take my order in passing but still had to wait.   I would have left sooner but was the to hear some accistic music.   I ordered a salad that was rushedly thrown on front of me.   

I finished my one beer and placed it out to signal I wanted another but instead she took my almost finished salad and my empty beer and went back to socializing with her friends. 

I couldn't handle such poor customer service,  and had the second guy get my tab.   I would never go there again. 

On top of that the $5 salad was about a half a Palm full of greens,  a rip off. 

That bartender though shouldn't be working,  she's doing harm to your business.

Absolutely gourmet delicious.  We both had the thick pork chop with a delicate honey/mustard sauce and tasty broccolini and au gratin potatoes.  Lots of changes have been made and the service was perfect.  The owner introduced himself and we enjoyed the conversation with him.  
We will definitely go back again and again!!!

The only good part of this place was the live music. You don't get much of that in Gilbert and the patio is really nice. But other than that...not much of a food selection and it's very overpriced. As well as the drinks! The Risoto Balls were terrible. The chicken tacos were not bad, as well as the fried pickles. But very pricy drinks after happy hour ends and the wait staff is very young and very unfriendly. Nobody smiles and you feel really uncomfortable. The owner came to talk to us and he seems very nice and hopeful the place will do well. It's very crowded on weekend nights, but I don't really understand why, due to the prices. I hate to say it cause I really wanted this place to do well, but Blue 32 next door is MUCH better. Very large menu and great customer service.

The food was really yummy but the low rating is because of the service. They are lucky we are extremely patient while dining cause many other people would be extremely irritated. 

Our server was very friendly, along with all the staff, but he was very forgetful. I ordered a water, my boyfriend ordered a beer. He received a sample of his beer and then his beer before my water. Then we ordered our food, still no water. Wait another 2 mins and finally get my water. We ordered two burgers, the Egg Burger and Southwest Burger, and fried pickles. 30+ mins later we received our burgers, no pickles. The server who brought our food out asked if we needed anything else, I said we are still waiting on fried pickles and I asked for a ranch. 10 mins later, I am assuming a manager, walked by and asked how everything was, I told him we were waiting on fried pickles and a ranch. He apologized and ran off quick to get out food. Comes back to the table to let us know my ranch will be out in a min and the pickles will be out in 5 mins. Why couldn't he bring me my ranch? Anyways, our original server appears and apologizes and give us our pickles, he said he forgot to put them in. At this point we are basically finished with our meals.

Had a lovely evening sampling craft beers with friends. Harvey American has a laid back environment making it easy to relax and enjoy yourself. While the selection of beers is world class, the bar food is also worth trying. I recommend the tacos!
Swing by for trivia and you won't regret it. The bar makes a mean dirty martini if you're not feeling beer!

The food is always great!  Love the beer selection. The menu was just refreshed with some awesome choices! Was able to sneak a peek at the kitchen, and it was cleaner than my kitchen and I spend time every day to make sure it is very clean. Love this place!

I have been to this place twice. My favorite food item is the black & bleu burger. It is so delicious. The second time I ate here, I tried the Jinglehopper cocktail. It's bright green and a bit overwhelming when you see it, but it was so delicious. They have great happy hour specials on drinks and appetizers, and the servers are friendly and attentive. I'll definitely be back!

Have been there a handful of times. Service and food are less than average. Just sat at the bar for over 5 minutes and not only did we not receive service, but the bartender literally looked past/through us to the people sitting in either side of us. She didn't even say she'd be right with us or acknowledge us in any way. We walked out out and went straight to Blue 32, which, not surprisingly, is packed for happy hour... they clearly don't have any real competition. Harvey American needs to step up their service and menu.

My husband and I came here for lunch and we were very happy!  The bartender Frank was very knowledgable about beers, offered menu ideas and very attentive!  Can't wait to visit again!  If we lived closer it would be our "go to" place!

Nice atmosphere, nice staff, ok food, but the service is always unbelievably slow! Especially if you're ordering drinks at a table. I'm assuming this is because the bar is slow getting the drinks out and not the fault of the staff? Idk. The servers never stop back even to apologize for the wait or check if you want a refill. Sure is frustrating, and unfortunate for the servers because we would most likely order many more drinks under other circumstances.

When I rate a restaurant, I consider the food, service and ambience.  

Those 3 things were great at Harvey's, however I am stingy with my 5 star reviews.

Some may find these critiques as minor, but the men's only bathroom-stall wouldn't close.  Also, the water they served tasted like unfiltered nasty tap water.
Don't sit at the bar unless you have a ton of time to kill...  mediocre food saved by good beer. This place is getting lazy.
OMG! Their food is so freaking good! The two I recommend is the flat bread or their burgers! Which they make the burger bun fresh each day! It is to die for!!!

Warning!!  Me and a friend of mine went here for lunch on a recommendation from a coworker.  We both ordered sandwiches in the bar area.  The sandwiches were large but bland and after taking my second bite of the sandwiches realized there were small bugs crawling around in my sandwich!  I called the waiter over and he immediately took it away and offered me something else.  NO THANK YOU!  We were not charged for the meal but I will not EVER go there again.  Check your food people!

This pub had a really cool look and feel right when you walked in. They had a band that was very good and at a reasonable volume. The beer selection was great! The server was very polite and was trying very hard, but seemed a little out of it. Most of the food was decent, but left something to be desired, particularly the chicken in my salad. I couldn't eat it. The French fries and skillet cookie were delicious, though. It is conveniently located so I will probably be back, but probably only for drinks, apps, or dessert. Thanks!

Pros:
Nice patio, great tasting drink (Orange Bliss), quickly seated

Cons:
Slow service, glass full of ice with very little liquid, long wait for food, rude bartender/bad waitstaff

Stick to Blue 32 even if there's a wait. There are way too many options near this place to waste your time & money.
Def not as impressive as I thought it would be. Food was bland and our waiter was horrible.
