K and I stopped by Blue 32 but since there was a huge line with a wait of 40 min+, we opted to walk down the way to Harvey's. We've been here before a couple of times and thought we would check it out again.

Unfortunately, my feelings about this place have not changed. The bottom line is it is a HUGE waste of what is a potentially amazing and awesome place. The first thing is, why does Blue 32 have such a long wait and yet Harvey's doesn't? The patio is nice and one side of the bar faces the patio. Inside or out there is just an uber cool feeling that this space exudes. But that's the building.

Our server this time was Alex. He could have cared less if we were there or not. He reminded me a lot of people I've trained in this business. You might recognize the type. They're the ones that are told they need to get a job and a friend is a server and tells them how much money they make and so off they go and apply at every restaurant in town and take the first job they get offered but hate every minute they're at work because they would rather be anywhere else because they hate the fact they have to work in the first place. Whew. That was Alex.

So the positive is that the happy hour goes until 7pm and it's 7 days a week. Awesome. Now if they would just have a happy hour worthy of having 7 days a week until 7pm. 
We each had a Summer Shandy ($4.99hh). Seriously, 5 bones for that and at happy hour to boot. 

Then we ordered the Nachos ($6.99) with Beef ($3.99). $11 bucks for crappy nachos. Here's what I said about them last time. Nothing has changed, they're still not very good. "I liked the chips as they appeared to be made on site but the Nachos as a whole, kinda sucked. There wasn't much cheese melted on the chips and they squirted some sort of spicy aioli all over the chips. There were sliced cherry tomatoes and green onions sprinkled on top. The chips themselves were burned in a few spots. All in all, poor attempt." Yep. Nothing has changed. 

Great Happy Hour days and hours. Crappy Happy Hour Prices and Offering. Crappy Service. Crappy Nachos. 2 Stars.

WE have been to Harvey three times now and would categorize it as OK.

The beer selection is great with over 20 beers on tap. mostly microbrews.  The food is ok, nothing great.

The bartenders have been good.

Came here a few times already with my girlfriend. We like to sit on the patio and have a drink. It's a beautiful patio! Beautiful lights and I've always received commendable service. The servers are well acquainted with their beer menu, which is a plus. After certain hours, they don't serve food anymore FYI. Great ambiance to have a drink with friends! I'll try their food next time I'm visiting.
Great food and great service. Place was packed for dinner and our meals came out timely and delicious! Can't wait to try again.

Mediocre at best. Food/ bar was the only good thing about this place. Bar service was prompt and appetizers were tasty. As for my salad.. Not so much. It tasted too sweet. I believe it was the strawberry salad. The waitress also liked to disappear for 30 minutes to an hour, even though it wasn't busy.

Save your time and money! We waited to be sat even though there were many open tables. The service was awful! We were there an hour before we got our food. And the food is mediocre. If I could give it negative stars I would.

The food is great and the drinks are usually good( but inconsistently made). The the that bothers me is the service: it is SO slow. The severs rarely check in, the bar takes forever to make drinks. If you want the check, you better ask when your order. The first time we were here, I swear our server was high or drunk because she asked us the same question over and over again. They are nice, but it really isn't impressive and they are honestly screwing themselves over. I would have ordered so much more if she had actually returned to the table! The servers eating in the party room really turns me off too, considering they should be working or out of sight... I think they may have sections that are just too large. Either way something should change because it's so frustrating I don't know if I would come back.

This is mine and my husband's favorite place to go out to. We go here probably once a week. Everyone is always extremely nice, great service, and the food tops it all off. We have tried multiple things on the menu and have never been dissipointed. Right now we love the fish and chips, fresh and crispy, we also enjoy their carnitas tacos, and any of their sandwiches. The bartender is always really great and is bringing my husband beer tasters through out our meal. Love this place!

Not Very Good and overpriced for what you get . We got the nachos and fried pickles . Pickles were good but the carne asada  nachos were made with  bland nacho cheese, cherry tomatoes,
with some kind of spicy sauce sprinkled over the top. I got the chicken pot pie, very bland and runny. Kids got burgers and fries. Fries were overcooked, and over seasoned...  Burgers were just OK. The service was fine, if only he had better food to serve!

Visited this local pub last night for the first time and had a wonderful experience.  My raspberry lemonade was delicious and potent.  My wings were big, juicy and flavorful.  Our waiter (I came with a large group), gave us pleasant and quick service.  I also had the pleasure of meeting one of the owners, Jim.

The outdoor patio with the fire and water display was comfortable.

All in all, a great time was had by everyone in my group.  We are returning next month and I plan on bringing more friends back to this locally-owned, non-chain restaurant in Gilbert.

Risotto balls? Yeah. That's what we thought but we ordered them anyway.  Don't know if I would order them again. 

We wanted to go to Blue 32 but they were too crowded and we were on our way to the airport.  Sigh.

The place is always empty and for good reason - the food really does suck.

My boyfriend and I stopped into Harvey American a few weeks ago before going to a movie. We tried to go to a place around San Tan village but found it to be too busy. We walked into the bar and were greeted by the bartenders. We sat down and a bartender explained to us the mug club and let us know what was on tap. They did well in checking in with us frequently enough but not too often. We came back last weekend and sat out on the patio. The decor was nice; I liked the fire pit and the seating arrangement. It really had a great ambiance. Again our Service was great. Both times we had drinks only, but I would love to try out the food. There is a good selection of beers on tap, which was nice! 

Overall- great beer choices, good location, nice patio and friendly bartenders!

My cousin and I ate here for the third time this week. The first time we left because of the mundane boring monotonous voice of the game DJ. But the food was good so we came back. So last night we enjoyed some fresh vegetables and some iced tea service was lacking but the tea and vegetables were good so we came back tonight to try some martinis. Our bartender was Joshua. I ordered a strong not too sweet lemon drop which came back tasting like lemon sugar water. After Joshua ignored us for approximately 14 minutes I finally had to get another server to remake the drink which was acceptable. After eating carrots and celery at 1 vodka and soda water and an order of wings they charged us $36. When discussing the bill they told us they charged us for the extra sauce, even though we had to send back three rancid blue cheese sauces which they replaced with 2 small Ranches charging us a total of $6 for ranch and $7.50 for a side of carrots and celery. They ended up taking off the first martini which we only took a sip out of. Joshua's response in a very snide and rude way was that the American Harvey doesn't give food away for free and what did we expect. So I will never go back to this place again and I am NOT shocked that their clientele is declining as per the word on the street in Gilbert. What a disappointment there are so many places to go in Gilbert why would anybody choose to return to a place where you are greeted by the snide rude dismissive behavior of bartender Joshua.

Food was okay, service was terrible. I had a party of three and we went on a Thursday evening. Walked in, not busy at all. It took about 10 minutes for a waitress to come up to us and ask us what we wanted to drink. By this time we were ready to order as well. We just ordered water, a soda, and a Bloody Mary. Maybe another 10 minutes later she finally brought the water and soda but we were still waiting on the Bloody Mary. We could see it sitting at the bar so almost another 10 min later my sister walks up to the waitress/bartender and asks if she can just grab it herself. The bartender says, "oh, I'm sorry! I made it but forgot to bring it to you!"
Finally the food comes out. We weren't given any silverware so we had to get up and grab it ourselves. I heard they have the best chicken tenders and had high hopes for them. These had to have been the most dull chicken tenders I've ever had. They lacked flavor and were very plain. 
We had to waive down any waitress that walked past us because ours was so inattentive! Terrible service and boring food. Will not go back.

If next door wasnt so busy we would have never given this resturant a try. The food is acceptable, the service is par for the course. I know it recently opened which allows for a little forgivness. I feel like this place is trying to rob for the Irish and give to America, the decor is confusing and the menu left me hungry for more, this place is confused at best. . Seems like a BAR that i would have a great time enjoying, however i will make sure to only drink there or get good and drunk and get McDonalds on the way home. .

Ok so I too went on opening night and one has to expect some bumps in the road.  I call my experience tonight, the good, the bad and the UGLY.

First the good.  The place is really nice, cool looking great bar, and an excellent outside seating area.  Our server (Audra) I believe her name was we spot on.  Ran around tending to our needs and felt bad about what is about to come (the bad and ugly).  Also great beer selection, and a very good menu which will get me back there to give them one more try in a month or so.  We also had the app sampler which came with Onion Rings (Black and Tan), Grilled Wings, Risotto Balls and Chicken Tenders.  All the items were very tasty but not hot, I am sure due to the pressures in the kitchen.

The Bad:  OK, again opening night, but it took the kitchen 1 hour and 45 minutes to get my wife, my daughter and myself out three salads for dinner. Once our salads came,  my wife ordered a Cobb Salad and what came out was a Wedge.  I got my steak salad and my 9 year old daughter sat there with nothing.  Not good!  After sending back my wives salad it took another 20 minutes to come out and hers came with my daughters.  I also saw other patrons waiting a long time for food, food was slow slow slow coming out of the kitchen, but again it had to be due to opening night (I HOPE).

Now the UGLY.  Look Owner (or possibly Owners who I saw there that night), its OPENING NIGHT.  Your joint is packed and you made NO and I mean NO attempt to walk around the place greeting guests (except for the tables of your pals).  I saw one owner sitting in a chair near the patio, and seemed focused on walking tables inside and out.  The other thing they seemed mesmerized in was this fire pit by the patio.  Its nice but if you have 100 people in your place on opening night all looking for food, shouldn't you stop looking at that and showing it to your friends and HELP?  Or better yet why not walk around the place  WELCOMING your new and potential future customers saying  thank you and at least showing some concern for the issues of the night.

Not to mention Hey Mr. or Ms. Manager, people WE SENT food back, why are you not out apologizing for the error in the kitchen?  Customer service is the #2 reason why I go to a place or not.  I would always prefer to go to a 4 star place with great service than a 5 star with no service.  

I have to assume that kitchen issues will be resolved and I will give the place a second try based on the menu and selection of beer.  But if this place DOES NOT get better customer service orientated with its management especially with Blue 32 next door (a great food and service joint) it will just be another place on the restaurant trash heap.

Where to start...

New place, so I still expect they're working out kinks.  

First the decor.  Nice...I guess??  Not sure what look they were after or how it ties to any theme (like that's really necessary) but I'm still trying to figure out the plan.  What I can say is that the seating is wildly uncomfortable.  This is something they need to work on.  On the other hand, once your ass starts to hurt I'm guessing you'll turn the table a little quicker.

Service.  Good.  Went at lunch so there was no crowd so they didn't get a full test.

Food.  Good...more on that.  

We had the Ruben and Italian Sausage sandwich.  Ruben was pretty good.  Not a traditional Ruben by any since but still good.  Italian Sausage was merely ok...not bad...just ok.  It had marinara sauce on it that frankly could use some work.  Had fries and cole slaw as sides.  Cole slaw was serviceable.  Fries were good.  But here's the thing...they put some sort of house seasoning on them which is not bad.  But, and there is a but here...there's a fine line between the right amount of this stuff and way too much.  I'm afraid if you ever got too much it could be a horrible experience.  Having said that my fries were good. 

Now I rated the good, and it was.  But, our waitress said they had hired a new chef (already?  they just opened) and were in the process of redoing the menu.  So maybe they know their marinara is so-so and that the stuff they put on the fries strides a fine line between good and yuck.  Or maybe not.

Regardless of the  above, I try again and see what happens.

We use to really enjoy this place.  They use to have great food and good music but the last few times we experienced bad service, they changed the menu and their choice of music put me to sleep.   I'm not sure what happened but I won't be coming here again.  Service was especially terrible Friday night!

Service was extremely slow--had to get up and look for our server three times. Fries were cold. They forgot to put all the ingredients into the salad! The bathroom stall was broken. The windows were filthy. Won't go back.

Went there this Saturday for lunch with the family. We ordered the bloody Marys which took about 20 minutes for them to make and tasted like tomato juice.. we had to add our own salt, pepper and it still was bland. I ordered the Italian sandwich in ciabatta bread. The sandwich was so dry and the bread was old and crumbling to the point where I just took the meat out of the bread.. The burgers were just "okay" and the rueben was served on a rye bun which added too much bread to the sandwich to enjoy it. The service was very slow and we had to continue to ask our server where our food was and for the bill after our table was cleaned off and we were done we were left waiting. There was about 6 other people in the whole place.. so it wasnt busy. At one point we even asked the server for our appetizer and he said that theres a lot of plates in the window.. uhm okay thats when youre supposed to bring it out. Originally heard this place was great which is why we wanted to try it, but the 6 of us were all very disappointed.

We finally tried this place b/c of the Groupon they offered, and we live right across the street.

I had the Fried Egg Burger.  It was okay, but the flavors didn't go well together, so it tasted kinda weird.

The real problem with the food was the fries.  They put rosemary on the fries.  That rosemary aroma ruined my whole meal.  What a strange seasoning for fries.

The one really positive thing about the place is that they have O'Dell's IPA on tap.  Awesome.

The service was good.

Three of us dined, and none liked it.  We won't be going back.  The fact that the place was nearly empty didn't help, either.
